Pandas

Data Processing

Load, filter, and manipulate CSV data using pandas through the Model Context Protocol. Provides powerful data analysis capabilities for scientific computing workflows.

1.0.0 Version
4 Actions
Jan 15 Updated
Python Language

Installation Methods

Global Installation

uv pip install scientific-mcps

Individual MCP Installation

uv pip install "scientific-mcps[pandas]"

Direct Server

uv run mcp_pandas

Claude Desktop Configuration

{ "mcpServers": { "pandas": { "command": "uv", "args": ["run", "mcp_pandas"] } } }

Available Actions

  • load_csv
    Load CSV files into pandas DataFrames for analysis
    Parameters: file_path, separator, header_row
  • filter_data
    Filter DataFrame rows based on conditions
    Parameters: dataframe, filter_condition, columns
  • get_info
    Get detailed information about DataFrame structure
    Parameters: dataframe
  • describe
    Generate descriptive statistics for numerical columns
    Parameters: dataframe, include_columns

Usage Examples

Loading and Analyzing Data

// Load a CSV file load_csv("data/experiments.csv", ",", 0) // Get basic information get_info(dataframe) // Filter data for specific conditions filter_data(dataframe, "temperature > 25", ["temperature", "pressure"]) // Generate descriptive statistics describe(dataframe, ["temperature", "pressure", "volume"])

Integration with Other MCPs

// Load data with pandas load_csv("experiment_results.csv") // Create visualization with plot MCP create_plot(dataframe, "scatter", "temperature", "pressure") // Export processed data save_csv(filtered_data, "processed_results.csv")
